intro: Pollia subumbellata, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Gesneriaceae and is characterized by its velvety, often dark green leaves. The plant produces showy, tubular flowers in shades of violet, pink, and white, which are typically borne in clusters. It is a perennial evergreen shrub that thrives in humid, shaded environments. Pollia subumbellata is popular as a houseplant due to its ornamental value and ease of care.
